title: Frank Lampard tried to lure Prince George into being Chelsea fan during Prince William pub chat
text:

Frank Lampard admits he tried to get Prince George to be a Chelsea fan during a recent pub chat with Prince William.

Lampard and the Duke of Cambridge recently united for a Heads Up charity initiative and shared a pint as they watched England's defeat to Czech Republic.

Prince William is an Aston Villa supporter and was recently pictured with son Prince George in the stands during the victory over Norwich.

Lampard admitted he couldn't understand why the Royal Family were not Chelsea supporters - and posed the question to Prince William.

"I asked why he supported Villa and he said it was because of a game he watched when he was younger and he felt that was the right thing to do. Then he’s obviously passed that down. I made a small attempt to get him [George] on the Chelsea side," Lampard told talkSPORT.

(Image: Getty Images)

“He did say George came home from school to say all his friends support Chelsea, but he’s going to hold firm and be a Villa fan.

“He was great value. I’ve got great respect for him.”

William had previously admitted he went to his first Aston Villa match in 2000 as they lost at Wembley, incidentally to Chelsea.

"All my friends at school were either Man United fans or Chelsea fans and I didn’t want to follow the run of the mill teams" he said in 2015.

(Image: PA)

Lampard will hope to continue Chelsea's strong start to the season when his side host Newcastle this weekend.

The Blues have bounced back from a slow start and sit fifth in the Premier League table, level on points with Leicester in fourth.
description: Frank Lampard and Prince William recently united for a Heads Up charity initiative as Lampard made the cheeky ploy
